channel.title: Interviews on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community
channel.description: Recent content in Interviews on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community

item.title: From #PSConfEU 2016 – A Conversation with Jeffrey Snover
item.description: This post is a bit delayed, but PowerShell Conference Europe 2016 was a blast. It’s a true global conference with both attendees and speakers from four different continents.

item.title: #PSConfAsia An Interview with PowerShell Expert Janaka Rangama
item.description: We concluded the first exclusive PowerShell conference in Asia a couple of weeks ago. It was very successful and there are already plans to take this conference around APAC region.

item.title: Interview with Darren Mar-Elia from MMS 2012
item.description: Editor Aleksandar Nikolic caught up with Darren Mar-Elia, the CTO and founder of SDM Software & <GPOGUY.com>, at MMS 2012. Darren has been a Microsoft MVP in Group Policy technology for the last 8 years, and has written and spoken on Active Directory, Group Policy and PowerShell topics around the world.

item.title: Interview with Jeffrey Snover from MMS 2012
item.description: Editor Aleksandar Nikolic caught up with Jeffrey Snover, Lead Architect for Windows Server and the Father of PowerShell, at MMS 2012.

item.title: An interview with Microsoft’s Scripting Guy, Ed Wilson at TechEd NA 2011
item.description: Courtesy of TrainSignal (a hat tip to Kasia Lorenc) we are presenting an interview with Ed Wilson conducted at TechEd NA 2011 in Atlanta.

item.title: An interview with PowerShell expert Peter Monadjemi
item.description: During the PowerShell Deep Dive at The Experts Conference (TEC) Europe 2011 in Frankfurt, Germany, Aleksandar Nikolic, one of the editors of the PowerShell Magazine, conducted a series of short video interviews with PowerShell experts.

item.title: Do you have any questions for Jeffrey Snover?
item.description: Jeffrey Snover is the inventor of PowerShell and I’ve always wanted to ask him what is his all time favorite trick in PowerShell.
